description:
This investigation was first published on EUobserver and is supported by Journalismfund Europe Once a popular kayaking destination, the upstream section of the Aura River in Pöytyä, southwest Finland, has become unrecognisable. Over the past decade, rampant plant growth has overtaken the waterway; in late summer, it’s possible to walk across the mass of irises […]

The post ‘A Big Dilemma’: Inside Europe’s Polluting Manure Problem appeared first on DeSmog.
title: ‘A Big Dilemma’: Inside Europe’s Polluting Manure Problem

description:
Robert Wilkie, who served as Donald Trump’s veterans’ affairs secretary, recently told a Heritage Foundation event that the former Republican president would slash climate spending if he’s elected for a second term, DeSmog can reveal.  Addressing the conference on September 17 in Budapest, Hungary, Wilkie said that he wasn’t speaking on behalf of the Trump […]

The post Trump Will ‘Kill’ Climate Budgets, Key Ally Tells Heritage Event appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Trump Will ‘Kill’ Climate Budgets, Key Ally Tells Heritage Event

description:
This story is the third part of a DeSmog series on carbon capture and was developed with the support of Journalismfund Europe and published in partnership with the Guardian. The UK government’s move to award £22 billion in subsidies to carbon capture projects followed a sharp increase in lobbying by the fossil fuel industry, DeSmog can […]

The post UK’s £22 Billion Carbon Capture Pledge Follows Surge in Lobbying by Fossil Fuel Industry, Records Show appeared first on DeSmog.
title: UK’s £22 Billion Carbon Capture Pledge Follows Surge in Lobbying by Fossil Fuel Industry, Records Show
